page.title: 06THE CHILDREN'S REC.
page.content: The Rec. is the place I like most in Burwash, not because of the fancy things like slides and swings but because there are secret places like little huts called 'camps'. One is very difficult to locate and this one is known as 'Hard Camp'. The others are called Bell, Brick, Tree, See-saw and Sugar-cane camps. You can do any- thing in a 'camp'and no grown-ups know where you are. The Rec. is connected to fields by passing through a gate, down the lane is a house where Alexander lives and next the Fire Station comes into view. To the west you head back towards the village, while to the north you head into another field that is surrounded by a wood, this is a marshy area with a stream running through it. To the east a row of trees leads to more farm land and a farm house.
